Class TwoDArrayPractice

  • java.lang.Object
    • TwoDArrayPractice

  • public class TwoDArrayPractice
extends java.lang.Object
    This program practices using 2D arrays using methods that create the arrays and print them out nicely

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TwoDArrayPractice() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[][] create2D()
      creates a 2D array that is numbered 1 through 16, with 4 numbers in each row uses parameter num to keep track of the numbers being put in the 2D array a uses nested loop to execute creating the 2D array
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method of the program.
      static int numDigits(int n)
      this function takes in an int n and returns how many digits n has
      static int[][] param2D(int n)
      creates a 2D array using the int parameter n the array is numbered 1 to n*n, with n numbers in each row uses nested loop to make 2D array
      static void printArray(int[][] a)
      This method prints an 2D int array nicely, instead of printing a memory address of the array.
      static void printArray1(java.lang.String[][] a)
      This method prints an 2D String array nicely, instead of printing a memory address of the array.
      static void printNice(int[][] a, int n)
      prints a 2D int array nicely, dividing each number with a '|' and divides each row with a line of dashes.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoDArrayPractice

        public TwoDArrayPractice()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method of the program. initializes 2D arrays, creates a 2D array from 1 to 16 using create2d method, and tests the param2D method with a parameter uses printArray and printNice methods to print 2D int arrays nicely

      • printArray

        public static void printArray(int[][] a)
        This method prints an 2D int array nicely, instead of printing a memory address of the array. uses nested for loops to print each row and column of array with each number
        Parameters:
        a - the 2D int array that is being printed

      • printArray1

        public static void printArray1(java.lang.String[][] a)
        This method prints an 2D String array nicely, instead of printing a memory address of the array. uses nested for loops to print each row and column of array with each String
        Parameters:
        a - the 2D String array that is being printed

      • create2D

        public static int[][] create2D()
        creates a 2D array that is numbered 1 through 16, with 4 numbers in each row uses parameter num to keep track of the numbers being put in the 2D array a uses nested loop to execute creating the 2D array
        Returns:
        a the 2D int array created

      • param2D

        public static int[][] param2D(int n)
        creates a 2D array using the int parameter n the array is numbered 1 to n*n, with n numbers in each row uses nested loop to make 2D array
        Parameters:
        n - the integer that dictates the size of the 2D array a
        Returns:
        a the 2D int array created based on int n

      • printNice

        public static void printNice(int[][] a,
             int n)
        prints a 2D int array nicely, dividing each number with a '|' and divides each row with a line of dashes. Uses a helper function numDigits to help determine how many digits each number has, and then, using this info, decides how many spaces will go after the number being printed before a '|' is printed
        Parameters:
        a - the 2D int array being printed nicely
        n - the integer that decided the size of the 2D int array

      • numDigits

        public static int numDigits(int n)
        this function takes in an int n and returns how many digits n has
        Parameters:
        n - the integer being tested to see how many digits it has
        Returns:
        count the integer of how many digits a number has
